title: [Large-scale] Advanced Mathematical Problem-Solving Project Utilizing Experience-Based Learning with Information Processing

context.prior_knowledge: High school mathematics fundamentals (functions, calculus, statistics) and basic understanding of programming languages (Python)
context.additional_context: Data analysis and mathematical modeling projects for real-life problem-solving, with experiential learning reinforced through team collaboration

learning_goals: Learners demonstrate the ability to systematically solve complex problems through mathematical modeling using real-world data.

In a 3-member project team, learners can perform the process of collecting, processing, and interpreting math-based data (minimum 10 samples) and submit deliverables for each stage of the experiential learning cycle (data collection report, processing documentation, interpretation conclusion, application case presentation materials), meeting at least four out of five evaluation criteria.

During the 4-week mid-term course, learners can record their mathematical thinking process at least three times in a personal learning portfolio and demonstrate peer-evaluated cases where they applied at least two problem-solving strategies, achieving an average score of 3.5 or higher on a 5-point rubric.

resources: Online data analysis tool (Google Colab, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
